channel.title: Does rs still use a jaggrab system
channel.description: i know its a longshot to try and get some information out of the moparscape cms, but does anyone know if jagex still uses a jag grab server and update server. from what i can tell in the client they no longer use the jaggrab system. however you cannot seem to just be able to grab idx2 cache from their server by connecting to port 43594. the folder dosnt appear to exist on their server, indicating that they do infact still use a jaggrab system. so if anyone knows the answer to this let me know and post here.

item.title: Does rs still use a jaggrab system
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

yes ive tried netstat just 80 and 43594.[br][size=1]Posted on: March 26, 2007, 01:11:12 PM[/size][hr]i have found by bruteforcing the cache download, that their is no longer a jaggrab server. instead the peices are scattered throughout the other caches, and then the client must pack it together at some point, rather annoying if you ask me.

Read full topic
item.source: Does rs still use a jaggrab system

item.title: Does rs still use a jaggrab system
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

personally idk why they do it part jaggrab part socket but its really annoying however for hybridscape im going to need to find where the jaggrab stuff is in a deob sense we will have the update server. yet i cant find it anywhere in the client. its probly in a static stringwrapper somewhere :Shudders:
